case_vignette: A 27-year-old man presents to the emergency department with pain in his right eye. The patient states that his eye hurts and that he cannot see well. He cannot remember when his symptoms started or what caused them. The patient has a past medical history of schizophrenia and IV drug abuse. His current medications include intramuscular haloperidol and nicotine patches. The patient has a 20 pack-year smoking history. His temperature is 99.5°F (37.5°C), blood pressure is 120/68 mmHg, pulse is 100/min, respirations are 15/min, and oxygen saturation is 98% on room air. On physical exam, you note a poorly kempt man and the findings in Figure A. Pain is elicited upon examination of cranial nerve III in the right eye. The patient is unable to read a chart on the wall of the exam room and complains of double vision.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
My right eye hurts, and I can't see well out of it.
Is this pain constant or does it come and go?
I can't remember when it started or what caused it.
Have you experienced any vision loss in your left eye?
No, just my right eye.
Have you had any headaches or facial pain along with the eye pain?
I didn't mention having headaches or facial pain.
Have you taken any new medications recently?
No, I'm currently on intramuscular haloperidol and nicotine patches.
Do you have a history of migraines or other eye conditions?
I have a past medical history of schizophrenia and IV drug abuse, but I haven't mentioned migraines or other eye conditions.
Have you noticed any redness or discharge in your right eye?
I haven't mentioned any redness or discharge in my eye.
Have you experienced any recent trauma or injury to your right eye?
I cannot remember what caused my symptoms.
Have you noticed any changes in your vision, such as blurriness or double vision?
Yes, I'm complaining of double vision.
Final Diagnosis: Third nerve palsy.
